T-DOSE 2012 Open Source conference Supporting 200 different expansionboards: the broken promise of devicetree

T-DOSE 2012 Playlist:
http://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLBZBIkixHEieUwHjKqPMc9ckLLsMKiK4j

Devicetree is marketed as the one ring to rule them all when it comes to non-discoverable hardware for linux on ARM. The problem with devicetree is that the complexity gets removed from the kernel and put into the bootloader.
This presentation shows how DT will be used on the beaglebone do support all the different expansion boards and combinations of those.

27 and 28 October 2012 at the Fontys University of Applied Science in Eindhoven.
title: T-DOSE 2012, Koen Kooi, Supporting 200 different expansionboards: the broken promise of devicetree
